job.title: Product Line Manager - CIP (32607)
job.description:
The recruitment team at Myticas is currently seeking an experienced Optical Networking resource who would be interested in working within the CIP vertical. 

We are looking for a candidate who is currently based in Canada since this is offered on a remote full-time permanent basis and requires the resource to be located within the country.

The candidate in this role should have the following requirements:

  • Highly experienced in CIP Optical Networking Deployment
  • Over 8 Years of Optical Networking expertise
  • Experience with Optical Network deployment and system development
  • Experience with Optical PLM
  • Experience with Operational Support Systems
  • Experience with Open Standards and Concepts

(~$180K - $190K USD per Annum)

job.title: Business Development Leader - Google (34233)
job.description:
We are seeking an accomplished and results-driven sales leader to accelerate growth within our technology business. This pivotal role will focus on uncovering and winning new business opportunities, while deepening our engagement and influence within the Google technology space. You will be instrumental in shaping and executing our go-to-market approach, collaborating with internal teams across sales, delivery, and partnerships to bring impactful solutions to clients.

Leveraging your deep knowledge of Google’s offerings and your ability to sell complex, solution-based services, you will establish credibility quickly, identify value-creation opportunities, and harness our organization’s full technology capabilities to address our clients’ most critical needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Proactively identify, pursue, and develop new client relationships in targeted accounts.

  • Partner with cross-functional teams to lead pursuit strategies and sales initiatives.

  • Build strong, trust-based relationships with decision-makers and influencers at prospective and existing clients.

  • Establish and maintain collaborative relationships with key contacts within Google, ensuring alignment and joint growth opportunities.

  • Support the development and execution of a targeted Google partnership strategy aligned to business goals.

  • Work with clients to understand business challenges and design tailored, high-impact solutions using the organization’s complete service portfolio.

  • Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to design and deliver effective go-to-market programs.

  • Represent the company at industry events, partner functions, and strategic meetings to showcase capabilities and identify new opportunities.

Success Indicators

  • Demonstrates integrity, collaboration, and professionalism in every client and partner interaction.

  • Develops a strong understanding of client industries, priorities, and challenges, earning recognition as a trusted advisor.

  • Engages curiosity and strategic thinking to diagnose client needs and deliver actionable solutions.

  • Promotes a collaborative and inclusive environment that inspires top performance.

  • Adopts and champions digital tools, data-driven selling, and innovative business practices.

  • Continues to expand market and technical expertise through ongoing learning.

Qualifications

  • Proven track record of building trust and credibility with stakeholders at all levels within client and partner organizations.

  • Demonstrated success in generating new business, leading strategic pursuits, and closing complex deals.

  • Strong background and hands-on experience in the Google ecosystem, including knowledge of product capabilities and partner programs.

  • 10+ years of progressive sales or business development experience within mid-market and enterprise environments.

  • Documented success selling professional services, cloud-based solutions, or digital transformation initiatives.

  • Highly results-oriented with a proactive, solution-focused approach to business challenges.

  • Experience selling across multiple industries in the Canadian market is an asset.

  • Post-secondary education or equivalent professional experience.

  • Team-oriented mindset with an appreciation for individual contributions to collective success.

job.title: Internal Audit Consultant (Banking) (34396)
job.description:
Our Toronto based Banking client is seeking an Internal Audit consultant to . lead stakeholder interviews, execute and document control testing (design & operating effectiveness), draft audit reports, discuss deficiencies, and help shape audit scope across multiple projects.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead interviews with management/staff to gather evidence for audit assessments.

  • Perform and document control tests; evaluate design & operating effectiveness.

  • Prepare clear audit reports with findings, recommendations, and action plans.

  • Discuss potential deficiencies with stakeholders; provide remediation insights.

  • Collaborate with the audit team to develop/refine scope; track progress to deadlines.

  • Stay current on banking regulations and internal audit best practices.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years internal audit experience in banking/financial services.

  • Strong grasp of internal audit methodologies/frameworks (risk-based auditing, COSO, etc.).

  • Excellent analytical/problem-solving skills; risk identification & assessment.

  • Clear, professional verbal and written communication with senior stakeholders.

  • CIA/CPA preferred (not mandatory).

  • Proficiency with audit software/tools (e.g., TeamMate, Archer, ACL/IDEA) is an asset.

Work Model

  • Toronto hybrid preferred; remote considered for strong candidates able to align to ET hours.

job.title: Google Cloud Practice Leader – Delivery Consulting (34134)
job.description:
Overview
We are looking for a strategic and hands-on leader to spearhead our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) practice. This senior-level role is designed for someone who thrives at the intersection of technical delivery, client consulting, and business growth. You’ll be instrumental in shaping and scaling a high-performing GCP services organization—overseeing delivery excellence, building innovative cloud offerings, and enabling client success across industries.

This is an ideal opportunity for a consulting-oriented leader who not only understands the GCP ecosystem but is also energized by building teams, solutions, and long-term client relationships.

RESPONSIBILITIES
 
  • Practice Leadership & Growth
  • Build, scale, and oversee the GCP services practice with accountability for delivery success, client satisfaction, and team development.
  • Guide strategic initiatives and collaborate with cross-functional leaders to align cloud offerings with business priorities.
  • Technical Leadership
  • Serve as a senior technical authority for GCP engagements—able to lead architecture discussions and solution reviews without needing to operate at a granular API level.
  • Drive high-level design and implementation strategies, working closely with technical teams and client stakeholders.
  • Client Engagement & Delivery Oversight
  • Act as a trusted advisor for enterprise customers, helping them realize the value of GCP technologies within their digital transformation journeys.
  • Ensure best-in-class delivery execution across projects—owning accountability for timelines, outcomes, and quality standards.
  • Business Development & Sales Enablement
  • Support pre-sales activities including opportunity shaping, proposals, solutioning, and go-to-market efforts.
  • Partner with internal teams and external clients to evangelize service offerings and identify new revenue opportunities.
  • Innovation & Enablement
  • Develop reusable delivery frameworks, methodologies, and assets to accelerate service delivery.
  • Represent the GCP practice in external forums and internal strategy discussions—helping raise visibility and influence roadmaps.
    EXPERIENCE
    • 10+ years of experience in IT consulting, cloud delivery, or professional services environments.
    • Strong technical foundation in GCP, with a proven ability to guide architectural conversations and lead multi-disciplinary delivery teams.
    • Background in services delivery, including experience designing and scaling cloud-based solutions for enterprise clients.
    • Experience in client-facing roles, with excellent communication and stakeholder engagement capabilities.
    • Demonstrated ability to contribute to sales cycles—providing solution input, influencing outcomes, and driving growth.
    • Proven success in building service offerings and bringing new solutions to market.
    • A leadership style that emphasizes accountability, ownership, and collaboration.
    • Familiarity with Google Cloud partnerships, certification paths, and ecosystem programs is an asset.
    • Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or equivalent experience.

job.title: SAP OTC Functional Consultant (34403)
job.description:
Our EIM, Toronto based client is looking for a hands-on SAP OTC specialist with hands on expertise in the areas of Order management, Billing, Integrations with Salesforce, etc. for a long term remote contract opportunity.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead/configure SAP OTC processes end-to-end (order entry  billing collections).

  • Design & optimize order management and billing flows; resolve production issues.

  • Coordinate and support SAP Salesforce integration for orders/customer data.

  • Prepare functional specs, test scenarios, and support UAT & go-live.

  • Analyze OTC KPIs and produce reports to support decision-making.

Salesforce, etc.

 

Qualifications:

·       10-15 years of experience in Order to Cash (OTC) processes and systems, demonstrating a deep understanding of the end-to-end OTC cycle.

·       Must have proven expertise in SAP OTC processes, including order management, billing, invoicing, and collections.

·       Must have certification in SAP OTC or related modules, showcasing formal recognition of skills and knowledge in this area.

 

Technical Skills:

·       SAP ECC:

o   Extensive experience with SAP ECC (Enterprise Central Component), particularly in configuring and optimizing OTC functionalities.

o   Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues within the SAP OTC module effectively.

·       Salesforce Integration:

o   Basic knowledge of Salesforce, particularly in how it integrates with SAP for order management and customer relationship management.

o   Experience in managing data flows between SAP and Salesforce, ensuring seamless operations.

 

Additional Skills:

·       Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address issues within the OTC process.

·       Ability to analyze data and generate reports to support decision-making.

·       Familiarity with the software and cloud services industry, particularly in relation to content management and data solutions.

·       Understanding of business AI and cybersecurity tools as they relate to OTC processes.

job.title: Field Application Engineer (34409)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a highly skilled Field Application Engineer (FAE) to join our client. In this role, you will act as the primary technical liaison between customers and our headquarters in Korea, focusing on resolving PCB-related quality issues and addressing technical inquiries. You will be responsible for on-site customer communication, coordinating with HQ engineering and quality teams, and providing clear explanations and solutions to ensure customer satisfaction. This position requires strong technical expertise, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage complex quality and technical challenges in a global environment.
Key Responsibilities
  • Serve as the first point of contact for PCB quality issues and technical inquiries at customer sites
  • Communicate effectively with customers to explain issue status, root cause, corrective actions, and technical solutions
  • Collaborate closely with HQ engineering and quality teams in Korea to perform Root
  • Cause Analysis (RCA) and develop corrective measures
  • Provide technical guidance and answers to customer questions related to PCB
design, manufacturing, and reliability
  • Prepare and deliver technical reports, quality summaries, and presentations for
customers
  • Support customer audits, quality reviews, and technical workshops as needed
  • Collect customer feedback and share insights with internal teams for continuous
improvement
  • Monitor industry trends and competitive solutions related to PCB quality and technology
Required Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics, or related field
  • 7–10+ years of experience in PCB design, manufacturing processes, or quality engineering
  • Strong understanding of PCB design tools (Altium, Cadence, Mentor) and
manufacturing processes
  • Proven experience in quality issue resolution, RCA, and technical troubleshooting
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills for customer-facing interactions
  • Ability to work collaboratively with teams and manage multiple priorities
  • Willingness to travel within North America

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with signal integrity (SI), power integrity (PI), and high-speed PCB design
  • Knowledge of industry standards (IPC, ISO) and quality certifications
  • Familiarity with semiconductor packaging or advanced PCB technologies
  • Programming or scripting knowledge (Python, C/C++, Shell scripting)
  • Project management or leadership experience
  • Strong customer-oriented mindset and problem-solving skills

job.title: ServiceNow HR Developer (34408)
job.description:
Our client in the Finance area is looking for a ServiceNow HR Developer who will enhance and support the client’s ServiceNow HR module—delivering changes to portals, catalogs, forms, and workflows while partnering closely with HR and internal technology teams.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • University degree or college diploma in business administration, statistics, or related field.

  • 5+ years hands-on experience as a ServiceNow Developer (implementations/enhancements).

  • Demonstrated expertise with ServiceNow Portals, Catalog Forms, and the HR module.

Nice to Have

  • Ability to use data/metrics to inform problem-solving for systems and infrastructure.

  • Proven ability to prioritize and meet deadlines while handling multiple tasks.

  • Experience leading discussions with a broad set of stakeholders (HR, IT, operations).

job.title: Project Assistant (34405)
job.description:
Project Assistant
Location: Chesterfield, MO
Pay Range: $21.00 - $23.00 / hour
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)

Overview

This position will be responsible for the management and organization of the document control process for engineering design teams, as well as supporting the account management team with the delivery of reporting, account wide communication, and seeking opportunities to provide innovative solutions to account level initiatives.

Responsibilities

  • Engineering Document Control:
    • Responsible for the organization and set-up of standards and procedures for the team.
    • Communicates document system procedures with team members.
    • Coordinates documents with multiple engineers for project needs.
    • Compiles electronic project data books.
    • Issues transmittals to clients and vendors.
    • Processes vendor submittals.
    • Responsible for managing relationships and expectations of client counterparts.
    • Packages electronic documents for clients, vendors, and internal needs.
    • Notifies appropriate person of troubleshooting issues regarding vendors and clients.
    • Performs document lifecycle management.
    • Performs quality assurance of managed documents to ensure compliance with client requirements.
    • Provides reporting on project document control status and other relevant metrics needed.
    • Monitors workflows for the project team.
  • Account Support Assistant:
    • Responsible for regularly scheduled and as needed client reporting.
    • Schedule account level meetings and gatherings.
    • Distribute account level communication.
    • Assist with goal tracking and management.
    • Create slide presentations for account leadership.
    • Seek opportunities within the account to create innovative tools and automation solutions from account initiatives.
Qualifications
  • High School Degree + min 5 yrs relevant experience.
  • OR Associates + min 4 yrs relevant experience.
  • OR Bachelors + min 2 yrs relevant experience.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint. 
  • PowerBI Experience and Advanced Excel experience are major pluses.
  • Good ambition to work well with others, has an interest in doing above and beyond, and takes ownership of the area(s) that they are serving. 
  • Positive demeanor and highly engaging.

job.title: Project Manager (34404)
job.description:
Project Manager - Municipal Drinking Water
Location: Denver, CO (On-site/field)

Benefits: Access to Client Benefits Package
Pay Range: $140,000-$225,000

Description:
In this role, you will lead some of the industry's best engineers while executing highly technical, complex projects including drinking water treatment facility, pump station, and water storage tank design/construction.

Responsibilities:
  • Share ideas and boldly explore technical solutions and thought leadership.
  • Bring outstanding organizational and interpersonal skills to lead project teams through challenging requirements and overlapping schedules.
  • Be excited to coach and mentor other engineers to shape the leaders of tomorrow.
  • Understand and apply conventional and advanced treatment technologies to solve complex water quality challenges for clients in Colorado and the western states.
  • Provide leadership and guidance through all aspects of engineering projects from concept to completion, including overall safety, quality, engineering, procurement, construction, permitting, project controls, and public/community relations.
  • Collaborate and coordinate with multi-disciplinary project teams to provide deliverables and services that meet internal QA/QC requirements and client expectations.
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for clients throughout each project, building a relationship as a trusted partner as the project progresses.
  • Develop and monitor project schedules, manage scope, and plan for the financial success of your projects.
  • Plan, organize, and communicate project personnel needs to department management.
  • Communicate project progress, cost and schedule metrics, design questions, and project challenges requiring additional support to department management.
  • Provide performance feedback for project team members as appropriate.
  • Work to proactively identify upcoming projects and opportunities; utilize business development skills to lead proposals, win new projects, and increase existing client base.
  • Leverage existing client relationships and focus on repeat work within each client account.
  • Manage the review, negotiation, approval, and execution of prime contracts, subcontracts, and change orders.
  • Be visible in the regional water and wastewater marketplace through leadership and participation in professional organizations.
  • Provide guidance and industry feedback or trends to the water leadership team.
Requirements:
  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management or related degree from accredited program required.
  • Minimum of 7 years of related experience (10 years preferred) in design engineering, including 3 or more years of experience managing engineering projects. Completion of a master's degree in a related field may be substituted for one year of experience.
  • Previous consulting experience preferred.
  • Professional Registration preferred.
  • Demonstrated success in project management strongly preferred.
  • Proven ability to develop business and establish relationships with clients is strongly preferred.
  • Prior experience on construction project sites or executing program management in the industries of aviation, commercial, energy, government, manufacturing, oil & gas, process, transmission & distribution, or water is preferred.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Must have the ability to clearly and effectively present complex information to all levels of employees, management, and clients.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
  • This position requires an individual capable of applying intensive and diversified knowledge of principles and practices to broad areas of assignments.
  • Must be capable of devising new approaches to problems encountered.
  • Ability to influence, lead and manage change thoughtfully and positively strongly desired.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, demanding work environment, ability to work overtime on short notice.
  • Excellent computer skills and proficiency using Microsoft Office.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with others (owners, contractors, engineers, designers) in a multi-disciplined project team environment to resolve design or drawing issues as appropriate and to accomplish objectives.
  • Strong experience with document control, scheduling, cost control and project management software


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Electrical Application Engineer (34401)
job.description:
Electrical Application Engineer
Denver, CO or St. Louis, MO
Direct Hire
$76,000- $104,400
  • Support the design, engineering, procurement, and product life cycle management of large-scale custom manufactured industrial equipment
  • Focus on 3 Phase Power Distribution
  • Produce power system designs for project applications
  • Work cross-functionally with business development group, clients, vendors, engineering, and the project management group. 
  • Use AutoCAD (Electrical AutoCAD preferred) to create power one-line diagrams, Wiring diagrams, cable/conduit schedules, panel schedules, panel layouts and creating of BOMs.
  • Conductor and raceway sizing
  • Sizing and selection of power distribution equipment including switchgear, motor controls centers, panelboards, VFD panels, transformers, lightening panels and other electrical equipment
  • Work with 480 VAC to 4,160 VAC 3-phase systems and equipment
  • Client facing bridging the gap between engineering and the business development team
  • Support engineers and Business Development to meet project goals and deadlines.
  • Perform quality work safely, being detail-oriented with superior customer focus in a fast paced environment
Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, power systems engineering, or related field. Equivalent experience may be subsisted for degree.
  • 5+ years in application engineering, design engineering, or technical support in electrical distribution, controls, or automation.
  • Experience with electrical power systems, protective devices and control schemes
  • Experience with utility, industrial or data center electrical systems
  • AutoCAD drafting experience beyond a basic level
  • Experience with electrical equipment component vendors.
  • Experience with utility, industrial or data center electrical systems
  • Knowledge and experience with the National Electric Code for sizing and implementation of conductors, raceways, equipment clearances, and other code requirements.
  • Knowledge of UL 508A, UL 891, NEC, and related standards.
  • Experience developing drawings for fabrication of wireway systems is preferred
  • Experience using ETAP electrical design and study software is preferred
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. job.title: Lab Information Management Systems (LIMS) Analyst (34412)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Business Systems Analyst-LIMS for 24+ Months Contract role at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite).

Job Description:

We are seeking a results-driven Business Systems Analyst (BSA) for a contract opportunity to support the qualification and deployment of data integrations between laboratory instruments and our Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS). The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with lab instrument operations, strong analytical documentation skills, familiarity with computerized systems validation processes (such as Software Validation and Software Life Cycle), and preferably exposure to LabX and Empower platforms.


Primary Responsibilities:
  • Author, review, and execute qualification protocols for instrument/LIMS integrations according to software validation and SLC methodologies.
  • Document and manage requirements, workflows, data mappings, and integration steps for lab systems.
  • Collaborate with lab personnel, IT, QA, and vendor teams to ensure successful and compliant deployment of solutions.
  • Conduct functional and user acceptance testing (UAT) of integrations, report findings, and verify remediation.
  • Support troubleshooting and technical investigations related to data flow and instrument connectivity issues.
  • Maintain detailed documentation of system configurations, compliance records, and qualification evidence.
  • Lead or support change control, deviation, or CAPA activities related to integrated lab systems.
  • Provide training and guidance to lab users on new integrations and processes.

Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience:

  • 3-5 Years of Proven experience qualifying or deploying data integrations in a regulated lab environment.
  • Working knowledge of laboratory instruments (e.g., balances, chromatographs, titrators) and their connectivity protocols.
  • Demonstrated experience with LIMS and/or other electronic laboratory platforms; experience with LabX and Empower is highly desirable.
  • Familiarity with software and computerized systems validation, including authoring/executing qualification protocols, requirements specification, and testing.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including technical documentation.
  • Strong organizational and analytical abilities.
  • Ability to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
Preferred Skills/Qualifications/Experience:
  • Experience with regulated industries (pharma/biotech/medical devices).
  • Direct hands-on experience integrating instruments with LIMS via middleware, drivers, or custom interfaces.
  • Knowledge of regulatory requirements for lab data integrity (e.g., 21 CFR Part 11, GxP).

job.title: Licensed Electrical Engineer - Battery Storage, PV/Solar Energy (34415)
job.description:
BESS Electrical Engineer

Location: San Francisco, CA
Direct Hire role 
Compensation: Depending on experience but ranging from 130,000-190,000
 

About the Company

A rapidly growing clean energy organization is building a localized battery supply chain that integrates recovery, reuse, and recycling of critical minerals. 

We are seeking a Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) Electrical Engineer to join our team. This role is central to designing scalable, high-performance energy storage infrastructure for both utility-scale and distributed applications. The mission is to build a sustainable circular economy for lithium-ion batteries by transforming recycled materials into high-quality inputs for new batteries.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead electrical engineering efforts for utility-scale lithium-ion BESS projects, from concept (system sizing, layout) through construction.

  • Interface with utilities and ISO/RTOs to support interconnection studies, permitting, and compliance.

  • Serve as internal subject matter expert (SME) for BESS-related technical challenges.

  • Design AC/DC electrical systems including transformers, inverters, combiners, and battery modules.

  • Develop schematic diagrams, single-line diagrams, wiring schematics, grounding, and protection strategies.

  • Specify and evaluate electrical components (breakers, contactors, fuses, EPO systems, meters).

  • Coordinate with civil, structural, SCADA, fire/life safety, and DC system teams for complete IFC packages.

  • Ensure compliance with NEC 705, NEC 706, IEEE 1547, UL 9540, NFPA 855, and local codes.

  • Support grid integration and interconnection with renewable and conventional sources.

  • Conduct power system studies (short circuit, load flow, arc flash, coordination).

  • Act as the Electrical Engineer of Record on assigned projects.

  • Stay current on BESS technologies, codes, and trends.

  • Lead R&D initiatives on integrating BESS with MVDC distribution.

  • Provide construction administration support (RFIs, submittals, site inspections).

  • Track scope, schedule, and budget across stakeholders.

  • Prepare cost estimates and schedules; perform QA/QC reviews and mentor junior engineers.

  • Contribute to internal design standards, templates, and best practices.

Desired Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET-accredited program.

  • Professional Engineer (PE) license in Nevada or eligible via reciprocity (must obtain NV and SC PE within 2 months).

  • 5+ years of experience in solar, energy storage, or microgrids; 3+ years in BESS design/deployment.

  • Expertise in interconnection and regulatory compliance for BESS systems.

  • Advanced knowledge of NEC 705/706, IEEE 1547, UL 9540, NFPA 855.

  • Proficiency in:

    • Microgrid modeling (HOMER or similar)

    • Power system modeling (ETAP, SKM, or similar)

    • AutoCAD/Revit, Navisworks, Bluebeam, Microsoft Office

  • Preferred familiarity with:

    • PSSE/PSLF, PSCAD/EMTC

    • SEL AcSELerator or equivalent

    • HVDC and converter station design

  • Strong understanding of storage use cases (peak shaving, load shifting, demand/frequency response).

  • Highly motivated, detail-oriented, and effective communicator.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

STSI Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

job.title: Data Science & Network Modeling (34373)
job.description:
The team at Myticas Consulting is seeking a Product Owner – Data Science & Network Modelling with deep expertise in network data modelling (especially IETF YANG), machine learning, and business analysis. This role is ideal for someone who can translate complex technical challenges into actionable product strategies, enabling data-driven decision-making across satellite and ground network systems.

You will design scalable data models and machine learning pipelines, apply ML techniques in cloud environments, and work closely with stakeholders to prioritize features and align product development with business needs. As the key link between technical teams and strategic objectives, you’ll define and own the roadmap for data-centric solutions that drive operational efficiency and innovation.

Main Responsibilities

  • Own the end-to-end product lifecycle for data-driven features and models—from ideation through development, deployment, and iteration.

  • Design and oversee the development of scalable data models, with a focus on network data standards such as IETF YANG.

  • Translate business needs into clear data product requirements, ensuring alignment between stakeholders, technical teams, and strategic goals.

  • Define and prioritize product roadmaps, user stories, and backlogs in collaboration with engineering, data science, and business teams.

  • Develop and support machine learning pipelines for tasks like anomaly detection, predictive maintenance, and performance optimization.

  • Apply statistical and analytical methods (e.g., regression, clustering, outlier detection) to extract insights and support business decisions.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, ML researchers, domain experts, and executives, to deliver impactful solutions.

  • Validate and measure the success of data initiatives using relevant KPIs, A/B testing, and performance tracking frameworks.

  • Ensure data governance, quality, and compliance throughout the modeling and product development process.

  • Act as a subject matter expert on data modeling and ML applications within cloud off-the-shelf solutions and complex network infrastructures.

  • Develop and maintain YANG models for telemetry and configuration data from satellite and terrestrial networks.

  • Design data models to support anomaly detection, predictive analytics, and network optimization.

  • Use data modeling tools to extract insights from high-volume telemetry data.

  • Build real-time and batch data pipelines using Apache Kafka, Spark, and Google Dataflow.

  • Deploy ML pipelines in cloud and hybrid environments.

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs, and align data initiatives with strategic goals.

  • Translate complex technical findings into clear business insights and visualizations.

  • Support data governance, lineage, and metadata integration across the data lifecycle.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related technical field.

  • 5+ years of experience in data science, data modeling, or cloud-based machine learning, with at least 2 years in a product owner or technical leadership role.

  • Strong experience in network data modeling, especially using IETF YANG or similar data modeling languages.

  • Proficient in machine learning frameworks and in building ML pipelines in production environments.

  • Hands-on experience with statistical methods such as regression, classification, clustering, and outlier detection.

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms and data engineering tools (e.g., Spark, Kafka, Airflow).

  • Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into technical requirements, and to manage a backlog and product roadmap.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience working cross-functionally between technical and non-technical teams.

  • Experience with Agile methodologies, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, and user story definition.

  • Strong understanding of data governance, privacy, and security best practices in complex or regulated environments.

  • Experience defining or contributing to organization-wide AI strategy or governance frameworks.

  • Knowledge of AI/ML infrastructure at scale, including MLOps tools and model monitoring strategies.

  • Experience managing AI use case prioritization across multiple business domains.

  • Experience with NETCONF, RESTCONF, or gNMI (Preferred).

  • Knowledge of event-driven architectures and real-time analytics.

job.title: UI/UX Designer (34417)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a UI/UX Designer role for a 3 months contract.  This is an on-site role, so candidates local to Grand Rapids, MI area are preferred.   Qualified Candidates please provide resume. 

Job title:     UI/UX Designer

Team: Digital Product and Experience Design Location: Ada, MI

What do we need:
We are looking for a Junior Product Designer with UI and UX Design Experience to join a team of Digital Product Designers and provide UI and UX Design deliverables to Agile Product Teams.

What's special about this role:
In this role you will sit on the Amway Global Digital Product and Experience Design team (DXD) with a number of other amazing designers. You will support Agile Product Teams in delivering world class software experiences, ranging from Native iOS apps to responsive web experiences. The DXD team is made up of both high-level agency resources and internal UI/UX professionals located in Michigan, California, Singapore and around the globe.
Together, you will create next-level experiences for our customers and Amway Business Owners (ABOs). Come join a team building the future of digital products and experiences at Amway.
 

Required qualifications

  • 1-3 years experience in UX/UI Design
  • Experience providing UX Deliverables to Agile Product Teams with support from other Designers or Design Leads, including: Wireframes, User Flows, Journey Maps.
  • Ability to create Low Fidelity Mockups, High Fidelity Visual Designs, and Interactive Prototypes
  • Proficient in at least one Product Design Tool: Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, etc (Figma is our tool of choice.)
  • Comfortable working with a design team to review designs and co-create.
  • Passion for learning and growing their design skillset.

Skills to be successful in the role:

  • Produce repeatable integration patterns and reference architectures; own troubleshooting across PAM/IAM stacks.

  • Provide knowledge transfer, best practices, and governance recommendations.

  • Create clear, business-ready documentation for technical/non-technical audiences.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • Degree/diploma in Computer Science, Information Security, or related.

  • 10+ years in IAM with focus on PAM.

  • 5+ years hands-on with CyberArk (on-prem and/or Privilege Cloud).

  • Deep expertise with Vault, PVWA, CPM, PSM, PTA, CCP, and web sessions.

  • Proven CyberArk migration experience (on-prem ? cloud / multi-tenant).

o Cadence Virtuoso, ADE

• Not required but preferred
o Perforce
o Ocean scripting and advanced modelling and simulation knowledge
o Linux OS support
Minimum Experience Requirements:
• 5 years of experience working as a high-speed analog & mixed signal IC CAD professional is required
• IC Technologies: High-speed IC technologies, including CMOS and bipolar.
• IC Design Software:
o Experience with configuring, documenting, and maintaining high speed analog IC design flows is a must.
o Experience with transistor-level IC design and verification software, e.g. Cadence Composer, Cadence Virtuoso, Cadence Spectre, Virtuoso AMS, Mentor Calibre, Skill language, is a must.
• General understanding of digital physical design flows, e.g. RTL coding, place and route, DRC/LVS verification.

Identify risks and proactively resolve blockers to keep projects on track.
Develop and manage detailed project plans, timelines, and deliverables.
Facilitate cross-functional collaboration between internal teams (creative, digital, product marketing, sales) and external agencies.
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in marketing, go to market project management
Proven success managing omni-channel campaigns with multiple stakeholders.
Strong understanding of creative development workflows and digital marketing channels.
Excellent communication, organization, and problem-solving skills.
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Asana, Smartsheet, Workfront).
Passion for design, furniture, or brand storytelling is a plus.

job.title: Payroll Coordinator (34435)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Payroll Coordinator for 100% Remote, contract or possible contract-to-hire opportunity.

Duration: 2+ Months Contract (possible further extension/ CTH).
Location: 100% REMOTE

Working hours: Expected to work 8:00 am - 4:30 pm PST shift. Preferably PST but any timezone will work.

CORE COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS:
  • 5+ years of U.S. payroll experience.
  • Hands-on experience with ADP GlobalView payroll processing (required).
  • Experience with payroll software implementations and integrations preferred.
  • Experience with report writing and payroll reporting tools a plus.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (v-lookup, pivot tables) and other MS Office tools.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to resolve payroll discrepancies.
  • Accuracy and attention to detail in high-volume, deadline-driven environments.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks with minimal supervision.
  • Strong collaboration and customer service mindset.

Job Description:
  • The Payroll Coordinator is responsible for ensuring accurate and timely processing of payroll for approximately 9,000 employees with a payroll value of $1.5B.
  • This role supports the entire payroll lifecycle, including payroll processing, reporting, auditing, and compliance.
  • The Payroll Coordinator will work closely with HR, Finance, and other internal partners to ensure compliance with company policies, U.S. federal and state tax laws, and payroll best practices.
  • A key focus is leveraging ADP GlobalView to execute payroll processes, troubleshoot issues, and ensure employees are paid correctly and on time.
  • Process U.S. payroll on a bi-weekly basis using ADP GlobalView, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
  • Maintain and update payroll data by collecting, calculating, and entering information.
  • Review source documents, reconcile discrepancies, and resolve payroll errors.
  • Prepare, document, and disburse payroll checks, payroll taxes, and employee benefit payments.
  • Maintain general ledger payroll maps; assist Finance with reconciliations and journal entries.
  • Provide reports illustrating payroll expenditures, including earnings, deductions, and taxes.
  • Support internal and external audits, ensuring adherence to corporate governance and internal controls.
  • Respond to employee payroll inquiries in a professional and timely manner.
  • Partner with HR and Finance to support projects, system implementations, and process improvements.
  • Contribute to the development and documentation of payroll procedures and policies.

Experience and Education:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Human Resources, or equivalent experience.
  • 5–7 years of U.S. payroll experience.
  • Strong hands-on experience with ADP GlobalView payroll processing (required).
  • Experience with payroll software implementations and integrations preferred.
  • Experience with report writing and payroll reporting tools a plus.
  • Strong understanding of payroll taxes, benefits, and compliance requirements.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (v-lookup, pivot tables) and other MS Office tools.
  • Familiarity with using AI tools to support reporting, analytics, or payroll process improvement a plus.
  • Excellent attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to resolve payroll discrepancies.
  • High level of confidentiality, integrity, and ethical conduct.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills; ability to partner across functions.

job.title: Drupal Developer (32659)
job.description:
The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for an experienced Drupal Developer who would be interested in a long-term remote contract opportunity offered within Canada (originally headquartered in Ottawa, ON).

Previous experience required:

  • Experience building web applications in the Drupal (7) CMS
  • Understands key server-side web development concepts through experiences such as:
  • Interpreting graphic visual or interaction designs in HTML, CSS and Javascript.
  • Creating visually appealing web pages or interfaces.
  • Creating, editing or modifying templates for a CMS or web development framework.
  • Programming interaction with JavaScript and/or a lipary such as jQuery, YUI or Prototype.
  • Testing cross-powser, cross-platform, and/or cross-device compatibility for inconsistencies.
  • Testing for compliance to specified standards such as accessibility standards (WCAG 2.0) in the clients region or domain.
  • Conducting observational user testing, or reviewing designs against usability heuristics.
  • Domain specific knowledge or transferable skills
  • Experience with web development languages of HTML, CSS and JavaScript/jQuery.
  • HTML
    • Familiarity of HTML syntax for multiple specifications, including HTML 5.
    • Knowledge of the semantic meaning of all HTML elements.
    • Familiarity with the semantic markup for display of lists, tabular data, forms, articles, etc.
    • Knowledge of markup used for layout such as dividers.
    • Knowledge at the level to be able to hand-code markup.
    • Including media and images.
  • PHP
    • Familiarity with modifying Drupal Theme hooks to display data
    • Understanding how to utilize PHP to filter, process and output html, json, xml
  • CSS
    • Specifying different CSS for various media, devices and displays.
    • Best practices in CSS file organization and structure.
    • Methods for including CSS inline, internal and external via linked style sheets.
    • How to define, combine and group CSS selectors for HTML elements, ID, classes, pseudo classes, child or sibling.
    • Syntax of CSS declarations, properties and attributes.
    • CSS box model and methods for CSS positioning, absolute and relative.
    • Knowledge of properties and attributes to control the display.
    • Familiarity with differences in CSS 2 and CSS 3.
    • Proficient with a CSS Preprocessor such as Sass or LESS.
  • Best practices
    • Drupal standards and modules
    • Methods to ensure powser & device compatibility
    • Methods for degrading gracefully for older powsers and displays.
    • Methods to ensure accessibility.
    • File compression techniques for improving speed.
  • JavaScript
    • Knowledge of the operators, variables, datatypes, objects, properties and methods.
    • Familiarity with control structures such as objects, functions, conditional statements, arrays, loops and expressions.
    • Forms and regular expression validation and submitting data.
    • Knowledge of how to apply logical operators and conditional statements.
    • Knowledge of the DOM HTML objects and their properties.
    • Event handling.
    • Creating and controlling windows and dialogs.
    • Processes for troubleshooting and debugging
    • Familiarity with development and debugging tools for cross-powser issues.
  • jQuery
    • Knowledge of how to employ the jQuery lipary for visual effects, event handling, and document manipulation.
